en: Knoxville, Tennessee plaque for Arnetta G. Wallace

This plaque given by the city of Knoxville, Tennessee to Arnetta G. Wallace (1904-1995), officially proclaims May 30th, 1987 Arnetta G. Wallace Day.  Mrs. Wallace worked in the Knoxville City school system and retired from Vine Junior High School.  She was active in many civic, religions, social, and educational efforts in the city of Knoxville.  She attended Knoxville College from her grade school education through her baccalaureate study.  She earned two undergraduate degrees from Knoxville College in Foreign Language and Music.  She was a leader in the Alpha Kappa Alpha sorority, serving as 14th International President from 1953-1958. Mrs. Wallace was a native of Knoxville.
Era 10 - Contemporary United States (1968 to the present)
